topic.title: Cascades Hike
topic.shortdesc: This is my date idea for outdoorsy couples or those who want to see the scenery that the New River Valley has to offer.

section.title: About
section.p: Whether you're a die-hard nature lover or just curious, the 66-foot waterfall is well worth the 4-mile hike. Located about 25 minutes from Blacksburg in Jefferson National Forest, the Cascades features mossy trails, sparkling rivers, and breathtaking mountain views. Cascades Mossy TrailA long, mossy green trail leads up the mountain, with a river to the left and trees to the right.

section.title: Review
section.p: I have hiked the Cascades five times, and I fall in love with it more every time I visit. The hike itself is a breeze â€“ you're literally hiking up to a waterfall. Thankfully for the less athletic people (like me), there is three trails with low to moderate difficulty so there's an option for everyone, regardless of their hiking experience.

section.title: Recommendation
section.p: The Cascades is one of the busier hiking spots in Southwest Virginia, so plan ahead to avoid the heavy foot traffic. While it's nice to swim in the creek around the waterfall, it's very crowded and humid during the summer. I recommend hiking in the mid-to-late fall, in October or November. The orange and red fall leaves are insanely gorgeous to see on the hike, the cool breeze will feel nice on the way back down the long trail, and fewer tourists visit, making a much better waterfall backdrop for a photo with your date.
